about.name: Vienna
about.info_text: Vienna, the capital of Austria, is a city with a rich history and a vibrant cultural scene. Known for its imperial palaces, classical music heritage, and elegant coffeehouses, Vienna offers a unique blend of tradition and modernity. Visitors can explore historic landmarks, such as the Schönbrunn Palace and St. Stephen's Cathedral, while also enjoying the contemporary arts and culinary experiences. With its world-class museums, music festivals, and charming streets, Vienna is a city that celebrates both its past and present.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 1.9 million
State: Vienna
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: German
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Vienna experiences a temperate continental climate with warm summers and cold winters. Summers are ideal for outdoor activities, while the city's Christmas markets are a highlight during the winter season.

attractions_card.title: Schönbrunn Palace
attractions_card.description: Schönbrunn Palace is a UNESCO World Heritage site and a former imperial summer residence. Visitors can explore the stunning palace, extensive gardens, and the Gloriette with panoramic views.

attractions_card.title: St. Stephen's Cathedral
attractions_card.description: St. Stephen's Cathedral, or Stephansdom, is an iconic Gothic cathedral at the heart of Vienna. It is famous for its intricate architecture and stunning views from the South Tower.

attractions_card.title: Belvedere Palace
attractions_card.description: The Belvedere Palace complex houses a remarkable art collection, including Gustav Klimt's 'The Kiss.' The palace's Baroque architecture and beautiful gardens make it a cultural gem.

attractions_card.title: Vienna State Opera
attractions_card.description: The Vienna State Opera is renowned for its opera and ballet performances. The opulent building is a masterpiece of Neo-Renaissance architecture.

attractions_card.title: Hofburg Palace
attractions_card.description: The Hofburg Palace is a historic palace complex that once served as the imperial palace. Today, it houses museums, the Spanish Riding School, and the presidential residence.

attractions_card.title: Prater Park
attractions_card.description: The Prater Park is a vast recreational area with an iconic Ferris wheel, known as the Wiener Riesenrad. It's a great place for leisurely strolls and amusement park fun.

attractions_card.title: MuseumsQuartier
attractions_card.description: MuseumsQuartier is a cultural complex with a range of museums, galleries, and cultural institutions. It's a hub for contemporary art and creative expression.

attractions_card.title: Vienna City Hall
attractions_card.description: Vienna City Hall, or Rathaus, is a stunning Gothic Revival building. It hosts events and is famous for the Rathausplatz Christmas Market in winter.

food_card.title: Wiener Schnitzel
food_card.description: Wiener Schnitzel is a classic Austrian dish, consisting of breaded and fried veal or pork cutlets. It's often served with lemon and potato salad.

food_card.title: Sachertorte
food_card.description: Sachertorte is a famous Austrian dessert, featuring a rich chocolate cake with a layer of apricot jam and a glossy chocolate glaze. It's a delightful treat.

food_card.title: Apfelstrudel
food_card.description: Apfelstrudel, or apple strudel, is a traditional Austrian pastry filled with spiced apples, raisins, and cinnamon. It's often served with vanilla sauce or ice cream.

food_card.title: Kaiserschmarrn
food_card.description: Kaiserschmarrn is a sweet pancake dessert that's shredded and caramelized, typically served with powdered sugar and fruit compote.

food_card.title: Coffeehouse Culture
food_card.description: Vienna's coffeehouse culture is legendary. Enjoy a cup of coffee and a slice of cake in one of the city's historic coffeehouses, known for their relaxed atmosphere and extensive coffee menu.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Sacher
hotels_card.description: Hotel Sacher is a luxurious and historic hotel known for its elegant rooms, traditional Viennese coffeehouse, and the world-famous Sachertorte.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton, Vienna
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton offers a lavish stay in a beautifully restored palatial building in the city center, with impeccable service and gourmet dining.

hotels_card.alt: Hotel Imperial, a Luxury Collection Hotel
hotels_card.title: Hotel Imperial, a Luxury Collection Hotel
hotels_card.description: Hotel Imperial is a historic luxury hotel known for its opulent decor, exceptional dining, and a prime location near the Vienna State Opera.

hotels_card.title: Park Hyatt Vienna
hotels_card.description: Park Hyatt Vienna offers a blend of modern luxury in a historic setting, housed in a former bank building. It's a short walk from St. Stephen's Cathedral.

hotels_card.title: The Guesthouse Vienna
hotels_card.description: The Guesthouse is a boutique hotel with a contemporary design, located near St. Stephen's Cathedral, offering stylish accommodations and personalized service.

transport_card.title: Vienna U-Bahn
transport_card.description: The Vienna U-Bahn is the city's efficient subway system, providing easy access to various parts of the city, including popular tourist destinations.

transport_card.title: Trams and Buses
transport_card.description: Vienna's tram and bus network complements the U-Bahn, making it convenient to explore the city. Trams are a great way to see the sights.

transport_card.title: Vienna International Airport
transport_card.description: Vienna International Airport (VIE) is the main international gateway to the city, providing connections to destinations around the world.

transport_card.title: Bicycles
transport_card.description: Vienna is a bicycle-friendly city with numerous cycling paths and bike-sharing services, allowing you to explore at your own pace.
